fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When JIRA is configured with an LDAP directory with "nested groups" enabled, the following message is displayed in the UI when trying to Edit Nested Group Members:
{quote}
Nesting of groups with 'JIRA Administrators' or 'JIRA System Administrators' permission is not supported.
{quote}
 !Admin_Group_Page.png|thumbnail! 

This message is a bit misleading considering that:
# it *is not possible* to add a group as a member of a group which has JIRA Admin or JIRA System Admin permission, via the JIRA UI (expected behavior)
# it *is possible* to do it via the LDAP directory and by syncing JIRA with it (not expected behavior)

h3. Steps to reproduce the 2 scenarios listed above

*Scenario 1 (expected behavior)*

- Connect JIRA to an LDAP directory configured with nested groups enabled (this configuration will make the button "Edit Nested Group Members" visible from ⚙ > User Management > Groups)
- Create a group called *jira-admin* in JIRA via ⚙ > User Management > Groups
- Go to ⚙ > System > Global Permission and grant this group the JIRA System Admin permission
- Go to ⚙ > User Management > Groups > Edit Nested Group Members
- Notice that this group is not part of the list of groups to which nested groups can be added, since this group has the JIRA System Admin permission 

*Scenario 2 (unexpected behavior)*

- Connect JIRA to an LDAP directory configured with nested groups enabled (this configuration will make the button "Edit Nested Group Members" visible from ⚙ > User Management > Groups)
- Create a group called *jira-admin* in the LDAP directory
- Create a group called *group-nested-under-admin* in the LDAP directory, and configured it as a member of the group *jira-admin* via LDAP
- Create a user in LDAP that is a member of *group-nested-under-admin*
- Sync JIRA with the LDAP directory
- Notice that the user ends up being both a member of group-nested-under-admin AND jira-admin (and therefore is granted the Jira System Administrators permission)
 !Admin_Users_Page.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Solution

It would be a good idea to:
- either mention clarify this behavior in our official documentation about [nested groups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/managing-nested-groups-861253195.html], since there is no explanation in the documentation about the statement "Nesting of groups with 'JIRA Administrators' or 'JIRA System Administrators' permission is not supported." that is displayed in the JIRA UI
- or make the behavior consistent in both scenarios, to avoid any confusion
fields.summary: Clarification about the message "Nesting of groups with 'JIRA Administrators' or 'JIRA System Administrators' permission is not supported." in the JIRA UI

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Sub-task - Bulk Operation produces 404 error page for users who are without Bulk Change global permission. Please note that the user is able to go through all the Bulk Operation steps until the end but not able to proceed further through the final step and encounter 404 error page. Hence, the Bulk Operation is not carried out in the end. 

 !Screen Shot 2018-05-23 at 5.56.18 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Use a user without the Bulk Change global permission. 
# Perform the bulk operation on the sub-tasks in a parent issue. 

h3. *Expected Results*
* They are not supposed to see the Bulk Operation option if they are given Bulk Change global permission. 
* Even if it is accessible by the user until the final step, JIRA should show a 'You are not permitted to perform this task.' instead of 404 pages. 

h3. *Actual Results*
JIRA show the user the 404 error page.
fields.summary: Sub-task - Bulk Operation produces 404 error page for user without Bulk Change global permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Quick search with multibyte keyword didn't work as Japanese customers expected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Confirm if *Indexing Language* is set to JIRA's default (*English - Moderate Stemming*)
 # Create a project which is called "あいうえお"
 # Create an issue whose summary is "あいうえお"
 # Input a keyword "あいうえお" in Quick search field

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be suggested in Quick search as the candidate.
h3. Actual Results

Quick search didn't suggest any candidate of *issues* with keywords like "あいうえお" and "No results." error was shown.
 On the other hand, the *project* "あいうえお" was suggested as expected with keywords like "あいうえお".

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Even though, the expected issues are not suggested in Quick search, pressing _Return_ / _Enter_ key in Quick search and you can see the issues in the issue navigator.
 It means that the following JQL filters out the issues as expected despite this problem.
{code:java}
text ~ "あいうえお"
{code}
h3. Workaround

Press _Return_ / _Enter_ key to perform the search in issue navigator.
fields.summary: Quick search with multibyte keyword doesn't suggest any candidate of issues

fields.description:
Our Java API incorrectly states that:
{quote}Note: This is an unmanaged IndexSearcher. You MUST call IndexSearcher.close() when you are done with it. (...)
{quote}
One of the sources: [Documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.9.2/com/atlassian/jira/issue/index/IssueIndexManager.html#getIssueSearcher--]

For details why it shouldn't say that see JRASERVER-67342
fields.summary: Jira API of IssueIndexManager incorrectly instructs to close IndexSearcher

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If {{IndexSearcher.close()}} is called it might result in closing the underneath reader and causing JVM crash with SIGSEGV under heavy load.
h3. Expected Results

Method getCountOfIssuesInIndex() will not close {{issueSearcher}}
h3. Actual Results

Method getCountOfIssuesInIndex() closes {{issueSearcher}} 
 You may see the following exception:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$AlreadyClosedException: java.io.IOException
at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$Helper.close(DelayCloseable.java:77)
at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseSearcher.close(DelayCloseSearcher.java:57)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearcherCache.closeSearcher(SearcherCache.java:79)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearcherCache.closeSearchers(SearcherCache.java:60)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.flushThreadLocalSearchers(DefaultIndexManager.java:1020)
at com.atlassian.jira.util.searchers.ThreadLocalSearcherCache.resetSearchers(ThreadLocalSearcherCache.java:31)
... 20 filtered
at com.atlassian.jira.servermetrics.MetricsCollectorFilter.doFilter(MetricsCollectorFilter.java:25)
... 26 filtered
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: java.io.IOException
at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelayCloseable$AlreadyClosedException.<init>(DelayCloseable.java:37)
... 57 more
{noformat}
h3. Notes
 * Under heavy load on Jira and execution of {{getCountOfIssuesInIndex()}} may close index that is still being read by another thread and as a result cause  SIGSEGV like this:
{noformat}
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
# SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0x00007f66338faaea, pid=66449, tid=0x00007f4dd99f1700
#
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_151-b12) (build 1.8.0_151-b12)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.151-b12 mixed mode linux-amd64 )
# Problematic frame:
# J 8554 C2 org.apache.lucene.store.MMapDirectory$MMapIndexInput.readByte()B (81 bytes) @ 0x00007f66338faaea [0x00007f66338faaa0+0x4a]
{noformat}

 * 
 ** More information why this is happening can be found here [https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-6943?focusedCommentId=15070960&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-15070960] 
 * Another example of SIGSEGV:
{noformat}
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
# SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0x00007fb0f16fa390, pid=63009, tid=0x00007f9fb94d2700
#
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_152-b16) (build 1.8.0_152-b16)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.152-b16 mixed mode linux-amd64 )
# Problematic frame:
# v ~StubRoutines::jbyte_disjoint_arraycopy

Stack: [0x00007fc9d9dc6000,0x00007fc9d9ec7000], sp=0x00007fc9d9ebfff0, free space=999k
Native frames: (J=compiled Java code, j=interpreted, Vv=VM code, C=native code)
v ~StubRoutines::jbyte_disjoint_arraycopy
J 109528 C2 org.apache.lucene.index.CompoundFileReader$CSIndexInput.readInternal([BII)V (55 bytes) @ 0x00007fdc036f1882 [0x00007fdc036f14a0+0x3e2]
J 23635 C2 org.apache.lucene.store.BufferedIndexInput.readByte()B (32 bytes) @ 0x00007fdbfb5b24b4 [0x00007fdbfb5b2400+0xb4]
J 31429 C2 org.apache.lucene.store.DataInput.readVInt()I (132 bytes) @ 0x00007fdbff486510 [0x00007fdbff4864e0+0x30]
{noformat}

 * 
 ** example at Oracle tracker: [https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8179671]

h3. Workaround

Don't close {{IndexSearcher}} returned by {{IssueIndexManager}} if you can.
fields.summary: Closing IndexSearcher acquired from IssueIndexManager can result in SIGSEGV

h3. Problem Definition:
Referring to the feature requirement, it appears that SAML Authentication at least needs the Assertions to be signed from the ticket below:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67292

But, this information is not included in the documentation. Or, any other information about the signing process or how the feature communicates with the IDP is not being mentioned.

The SAML Documentation for Atlassian Data Center is below:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/saml-single-sign-on-for-atlassian-data-center-applications-857050705.html

h3. Suggestion Solution:
It would be great if such information is included in the documentation to help with the IDP side configuration.
fields.summary: SAML for Atlassian Data Center Documentation to include Signing information

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JIRA searching capability is only limited to Issue's Summary, Description and Comments. It is not possible to search for keywords that are located in Project's Description just like in Confluence. This would be a useful function to have that will allow users to search for projects that are relevant to certain keywords.

h3. Suggested Solution
Extend the searching capability to include keywords in Project's Description.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Allow for JIRA to search for keywords in Project's Description

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It's not possible to specify a user id when using the AMI template in AWS, so the Jira user id will be random.

h3. Suggested Solution
Modify the template to allow this option. Currently, the Bitbucket template allows it.

h3. Template difference
[Bitbucket|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/src/master/ami/bitbucket.json]
{code}
    "type": "shell",
    "script": "scripts/add-user.sh",
    "environment_vars": [
      "USER={{user `user`}}",
      "USER_ID={{user `user_id`}}",
      "COMMENT=\"Atlassian {{user `short_display_name`}}\""
{code}
[Jira|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/src/master/ami/jira.json]
{code}
    "type": "shell",
    "script": "scripts/write-product-config.sh",
    "environment_vars": [
      "LOCATION={{user `config_location`}}",
      "LOG={{user `log_location`}}",
      "VERSION={{user `version`}}",
      "USER={{user `user`}}",
      "HOME={{user `home_dir`}}",
      "APP_DATA_BLOCK_DEVICE={{user `app_data_block_device`}}",
      "APP_DATA_MOUNT={{user `app_data_mount`}}",
      "APP_DATA_FS_TYPE={{user `app_data_fs_type`}}",
      "APP_DATA_DIR={{user `app_data_dir`}}",
      "NAME={{user `name`}}",
      "SHORT_DISPLAY_NAME={{user `short_display_name`}}",
      "FULL_DISPLAY_NAME={{user `full_display_name`}}",
      "DB_DIR={{user `db_dir`}}",
      "DB_NAME={{user `db_name`}}",
      "DB_USER={{user `db_user`}}",
      "INSTALL_DIR={{user `install_dir`}}",
      "INSTANCE_STORE_BLOCK_DEVICE={{user `instance_store_block_device`}}",
      "INSTANCE_STORE_MOUNT={{user `instance_store_mount`}}",
      "RELEASE_S3_BUCKET={{user `release_s3_bucket`}}",
      "RELEASE_S3_PATH={{user `release_s3_path`}}"
{code}
fields.summary: Add Option to Specify UserID in AWS AMI Template

fields.description:
Currently, when you make someone an admin in an existing Jira environment, it'll be presented with the options to create a sample project, create a new project or to import issues.

Those 3 are usually not relevant for new admins in an existing Jira environment.

I'd like to suggest to either add a button 'Skip and proceed to Dashboard' or make this optional per user.

What currently happens is that many new 'sample' projects are created, including all the new schemes which gives admins a lot of things to clean up afterwards.
fields.summary: Add option to 'Skip' and proceed to the Dashboard for new Jira admins

fields.description:
I found the following statement in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/advanced-searching-operators-reference-939937721.html#Advancedsearching-operatorsreference-DOES_NOT_CONTAINDOESNOTCONTAIN:!~]
{quote}The "!~" operator is used to search for issues where the value of the specified field matches the specified value. For use with version and text fields only, i.e.:
{quote}
I believe this should be "the value of the specified field *doesn't match* the specified value". Could you please check?
fields.summary: possible error in "Advanced searching - operators reference"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After upgrade to Jira 7.6.4 customers with 10k+ users see major performance degradation. Jira is hitting {{propertyentry}} table up to 10x times more causing DB overload. 
Problem is amplified in correlation with another issue - JRASERVER-65168. 

h3. Environment
* Jira 7.6.4/7.6.5 (please note that only these versions are affected from 7.6 branch) or other _Affected versions_ 

h3. Expected Results
The number of requests to the {{propertyentry}} table is the same as before.

h3. Actual Results
The number of requests to the {{propertyentry}} table increased 10 times. 
 
h3. Notes
h5. Root cause 
As part of a fix for JRASERVER-67041 users attributes cache was switched to short leaving one to eliminate the need for cluster cache replication. Some features like user picker or Jira service desk iterate many users' attributes entries and as a result DB load is increased significantly as user attributes cache is usually empty. 

h3.Workaround
Set system property to revert the changes (code will work as pre-7.6.4):
* add to JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
-Djira.cache.CachingOfBizPropertyEntityStore.ApplicationUser.remote=true
{code}
fields.summary: Performance degradation due to a high number of requests to the table propertyentry

fields.description:
h3. Summary
# Create a Select List (Single Select) Custom Field and add in "և" as an option
# Create an issue and assign the created custom field with the option value
# Go to Issue Navigator and set the JQL to filter out issues with option value "և"

h3. Expected Results
Able to see the issue that has been assigned the "և" option

h3. Actual Results
Is getting a JQL error
 !JQLBug.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Replace all the "և" characters with "եւ"
 !JQLBug2.png|thumbnail! 

Interestingly enough, if the Custom Field has both options ("և" & "եւ"), when the JQL is set to search for issues with "և", there will not be any error messages but the results will show issues with the "եւ" option:
 !JQLBug4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JQL is not able to search for issues using "և" character in the field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a customer has a large number of screens and/or workflos in the Screens page {{/secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa}}, the page takes a long time to load.

An example with 2000+ screens and 3400+ workflows took around 28 minutes to load a page with 27 minutes waiting for Jira application.

h3. Environment
* 2000+ screens
* 3000+ workflows

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have large number of Screens 
# Have large number of Workflows 
# Open {{/secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa}}

h3. Expected Results
The Screen page load fast

h3. Actual Results
The Screen page load slow

Thread dumps show long running trying to load data from workflows
{noformat}
"https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-27 uri:/jira/secure/admin/views/issu...screens/viewfieldscreens.jsp username:XXXXXX" #316 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f8ad4946800 nid=0x2bd6 runnable [0x00007f8a5c979000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.lang.Throwable.fillInStackTrace(Native Method)
	......
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.loader.WorkflowLoader.load(WorkflowLoader.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowUtil.convertXMLtoWorkflowDescriptor(WorkflowUtil.java:198)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.CachingDraftWorkflowStore.convertXMLtoWorkflowDescriptor(CachingDraftWorkflowStore.java:104)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.CachingDraftWorkflowStore.getJiraDraftWorkflow(CachingDraftWorkflowStore.java:113)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

JIRA Chart gadget shows a generic error when the JQL contains reserved words:

 !Screen Shot 2018-05-18 at 11.33.26.png|thumbnail! 

As we can see, as the project name is NOT, the JQL fails. However, we don't have a clear error that the lack of quotation marks on the name is causing this problem. There is just the generic message that the chart image could not be loaded.

h3. Suggested Solution

The Chart gadget should behave as the JIRA issues macro. When we use a reserved word without quotes, we see this error:

 !Screen Shot 2018-05-18 at 11.32.49.png|thumbnail! 

The chart macro should also be able to detect JQL syntax or semantic problems and could present that exact same error.

h3. Why this is important

The current behavior is not helpful in investigating the cause of the problem. If we had the same message as in the JIRA issues macro, the end user could resolve the JQL problem on his own, not needing to contact support to understand the problem.
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Charts error messages when there are problems in the JQL query

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Inserting a table in Visual mode and save it will cause the table to be misformatted. 

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Open any Service Desk project issues from the Queues. 
# Add or edit description/comment. 
# Make sure you are on the Visual mode. 
# Insert or copy a table to Description or Comment by using the !Screen Shot 2018-05-18 at 9.53.03 PM.png|thumbnail! > Table. 
# Save by 'Share with customer' or 'Comment internally'.

h3. *Expected Results*
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-18 at 9.50.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Actual Results*
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-18 at 9.50.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Workaround*
Re-edit the description/comment in text mode to fix the table format. 

h3. *Notes*
This is only reproducible when the URL of the issue is like <base-URL>/projects/<project-key>/queues/custom/<queue-id>/<issue-key>. It's working fine if editing the issue on a page URL like <base-URL>/browse/<issue-key>.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor in Service Desk: Insert table in Visual mode and save will cause the table to be misformatted.

fields.description:
We recently updated to Jira Server 7.9.2. Love that you can add sprint goals now!

There is only one text box for this to add one line. We usually have 2 or 3 goals.

Are there any plans to be able to add multiple goals on multiple lines?

thanks
fields.summary: Adding sprint goals

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JIRA does not have a function to configure the default Project Avatar. It will be useful to have this feature as some users would prefer to use their own custom logo as the default Project Avatar which would be applied to all newly created projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add in the configuration option to set the logo for default Project Avatar

h3. Workaround 
Replace the 'Default.svg' file in the *<JIRA_INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/avatars* directory with the desired logo. However, this workaround is not able to change the Project Avatar at the project sidebar:
 !Project.png|thumbnail! 

To change the Project Avatar at the project sidebar, users will need to manually change to the desired logo at *Project Settings > Details* page for each of the projects.
fields.summary: Ability to configure default Project Avatar in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When mentioning users in a restricted comment, the list will include users that are not part of the Project Role/Group associated to the restricted comment. Due to security design, if the user is not part of the Project Role/Group of the restricted comment, they will not receive the email notification. 

The problem is that the email will be silently dropped with no prior warning/message.

h3. Suggested Solution
In the mention list, exclude or have something to indicate users that are not part of the restricted comments.

Alternatively, have some warning/message that the mentioned user will not receive the email notification due to them not part of the restricted comment.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Have some indication/message that the mentioned user in a restricted comment is not able to receive email notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It can take a really long time to when trying to open the Workflow page at {{/secure/admin/workflows/ListWorkflows.jspa}}. Having a total of 3500 workflows including draft workflows can take up to 7 minutes to load the page.

h3. Environment
* 3500+ workflows

h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Windows copying content from multiline text custom fields, comments or description containing multiple lines of text from a Jira issue adds in various spaces in random locations on the Paste action when copied from Chrome, Edge, or Internet Explorer 11, this causes overhead in reformatting content when trying to share information between Jira and alternate platforms.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy multi line text from jira
# Paste the values into another application such as a text editor like notepad or notepad++

h3. Expected Results
Formatting maintained

h3. Actual Results
Chrome:
{code}
word
word<Space added here>
word<Space added here>
word<Space added here>
{code}
IE 11:
{code}
word
<Space added here>word
<Space added here>word
<Space added here>word
{code}
Edge (Same behavior as Chrome):
{code}
word
word<Space added here>
word<Space added here>
word<Space added here>
{code}
 
h3. Notes
Using Notepad++ *View >> show symbol >> Show all characters*  you can see this is occuring on a Carriage return then a line feed "/r/n" behavior on Windows OS

h3.Workaround
This works without issue if copied from FireFox, and only affects Windows OS, and some Linux OS but Mac copy paste is not impacted, EXE of the behavior in various scenarios can be seen here:
!Copy_paste_behavior.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Windows Copy Paste Functionality adds extra Spaces some browsers

fields.description:
It would be great if JIRA allows us to restrict setting of certain priorities to certain users.

Example: 
# We have 5 priorities for the JIRA issues (Blocker, Critical, Major, Minor, Trivial)
# We want just a few people (project leads, managers) to be able to set the issues priority to Blocker or Critical
# All other priorities should be available for everyone
fields.summary: Restrict Setting Of Certain Priorities To Certain Users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Issue Exports are streamed directly to the client upon being requested and fully created. This implementation has some drawbacks that can be addressed if the exports are actually stored in the Jira server's filesystem, rather than streamed to the client.

h3. Suggested Solution

Change the implementation, or offer an option to allow the administrators to configure, for Issue Exports to be saved to the local server's filesystem, rather than being streamed to the client. This is similar to how Support ZIPs are saved to the filesystem, and a download link is offered to the client.

Possibly even allow for a *Notify me when done* functionality, to send the download link directly to the requesting user via email.

h3. Why this is important
 
This implementation offers the following benefits:
* Administrators would have access to the export anytime for diagnosis purposes
* Subsequent downloads would be possible instead of having to generate an export again if another copy of the same export was desired. 

It could have possible drawbacks, which would be the responsibility of the administrators, or perhaps a scheduled cleanup job to handle:
* A large instance with many users requesting exports may quickly fill up the filesystem
fields.summary: Allow for Issue Exports to be saved to the Jira filesystem

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira either does not have, or does not publish instructions on how to enable, DEBUG level logging for Issue Export functionalities. Issue Exports are provided by the *Issue Views Plugin*, a System Add-on included with Jira, but enabling DEBUG logging against this package does not provide any new logging output.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement DEBUG level logging against the Issue Views Plugin for increased logging for export functionalities. Such logging can include details such as:
* Progress of the export, as a percentage of progress
* An understanding of what values are pulled from issues, or what columns are being used in the export

h3. Why this is important
 
Administrators need to be able to monitor the progress and outcome of the various exports performed in the instance. Knowing the progress of the export towards completion, as well as identifying what values and columns are populating the export, are examples of valuable information for administrators.
fields.summary: Add or Enable DEBUG Logging for Issue Exports

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, our documentation states the following for the CC Assignee option for mail handlers:
 - The email address (registered with their Jira account) matches the first matching address encountered in the To:, then Cc: and then Bcc: field of the email message received.

In Jira, this shows the following as the first CC'd assignee will be assigned the issue, with no mentions of the other mail fields:

!Screen Shot 2018-05-16 at 7.53.34 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

This option for mail handlers should explicitly list what fields are chosen from as listed in this documentation:
 - [Creating issues and comments from email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-861253784.html]

h3. Actual Results

This option is not listed and causes confusion for users who enable this option for their mail handler, not knowing specifically the To and Bcc fields will also be read from.
fields.summary: Discrepancy in documentation for CC Assignee option for Mail Handlers

It should be "Исправить в версиях" but in the notification about the creation of the request it's "Подготовить продукты" now.

2. When you log in to the Jira system, in a pop-up window displayed "ИзвиТите, Вам необходимо правильно ответить на вопрос для проверки подлинности", instead of correct "Извините, Вам необходимо правильно ответить на вопрос для проверки подлинности".

fields.description:
As a Jira admin I'd like a field schema configuration screen where the page won't reload every time I make any change.

When you have a sizeable amount of fields, even the simpliest configuration (either show hide a given field) becomes tedious because every time you make a change you have to relocate where you were since page reloading takes you back to the start of the page.

I propose something similar to the attached image. We could make any change but this wouldn't have any effect until the "commit changes" button is pressed. If the page is going to be left without commiting changes a warning could pop up.
fields.summary: Field schema configuration screen revamp

fields.description:
Dear team,

My Name is Nathasit. I works at Ayudhya Allianz, Thailand. We are facing with 2 issues of JIRA system.

Firstly, the performance of JIRA is very slow. As a result, I cannot access some features of administrator page such as setting the custom field, workflow, etc. (Page cannot load).

 

As investigated, the physical memory and CPU of the server is *available*. However, I have looked at the memory of the JAVA and found that almost memory is used. Is this the cause of the issue? If so, please suggest how to increase the memory of the Java by providing the step to configure. Also, do we need to shut-down for configure? !Performance.jpg!

 

Secondly, we would like to change the date format of the ticket. As below picture, the date was shown as 4 day ago but we want to change as *dd/mm/yy HH:MM* *a*. (16/05/18 11:00 am).

I’m not sure about the configuration for changing the format. Could you check and provide the step by step to configure, please.

 

!JIRA.jpg!

 

!set.png!

Your prompt response would be highly appreciated. Thank you.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.

fields.description:
It would be a much better user experience if the *Global Mail Settings* administration menu explicitly stated that those options only apply to Jira Service Desk. I was only able to discover this after reading [Managing the email channel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/managing-the-email-channel-732528949.html], and it caused quite a few emails to be processed by our development and staging servers.

I propose renaming it to *Service Desk Mail Settings*, as there is nothing global about it currently, and it is nested with the rest of the standard Jira mail handler settings. At the very least some warning text would spare some confusion for other users in the future.
fields.summary: Explicitly note that "Global" Mail Setting options only affect Service Desk

fields.description:
I am using JIRA Software Server in a Docker container. Java 8u131 or later supports the option to use container memory limits as Java heap size (see [Oracle's article|https://blogs.oracle.com/java-platform-group/java-se-support-for-docker-cpu-and-memory-limits]). I removed {{-Xmx -Xms}}, added the following options and started a container, but JIRA server showed the following error.

Options:
{code:java}
-XX:+UnlockExperimentalVMOptions -XX:+UseCGroupMemoryLimitForHeap
{code}
Error:
{quote}
h5. Setup: Your memory allocation pool settings need attention

JIRA runs in a Java virtual machine (JVM), and this JVM is allocated an amount of memory to enable JIRA to run. These amounts can be manually configured.
 * The maximum memory allocation pool (-Xmx) is required to be at least 786m.

!image-2018-05-14-21-45-59-554.png|width=480!
{quote}
Is there any plan to support {{UseCGroupMemoryLimitForHeap}} option?

In addtion, Java 10 or later does not require the option and automatically detect container memory limits (see [JDK bug database|https://bugs.java.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=8189497]).
fields.summary: JIRA server always requires Xmx and Xms options

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
When using *IssueLinkCreatedEvent* to create multiple links simultaneously, the events are duplicated.

h3. *Environment*
* JIRA version 7.6.0
* JIRA version 7.9.2

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Use a script to form a loop that will call *IssueLinkCreatedEvent* to create multiple links to simultaneously.
# Create 30 links using the mentioned script.

h3. *Expected Results*
30  new links are created successfully

h3. *Actual Results*
22 new links are created successfully but 8 more links are missing though the logs show 30 links is created. When we checked the creation logs it seems like certain links are duplicated.

h3. *Notes*
It seems like *IssueLinkCreatedEvent* takes time to complete creation and linking of an issue when we call the event to run at a faster rate it causes the behavior to happen.

We have attached the sample script that can be used to reproduce the behavior for DEV reference  [^issue link script.groovy] 

h3. *Workaround*
# Currently there is no direct workaround for this behavior however, users can still utilize [webhook|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/webhooks/] to create and link issue at their end.
fields.summary: IssueLink Created Event Is Not Working Fine for Multiple Link Created In a Short Period Of Time

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Date picker shows 'undefined' on Project Release screen if the language is set to Russian, French, German or some other language

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set JIRA language to Russian
# Go to Project > Releases
# Click three dots (Actions) by the version you want to release > select Release 
# Open the date picker in order to change the date

h3. Expected Results
Calendar shows dates as expected.

h3. Actual Results
Calendar shows 'undefined' instead of dates:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

h4. Workaround 1
Set language to English in your User profile before releasing the version.

h4. Workaround 2
Set the version's release date before clicking the Release button. This can be done Project settings > Releases > press three dots (Actions) button > Edit and change dates.

h4. Workaround 3
Click Project settings cog > Versions > publish the Version from here, as 'undefined' text will not appear here.
fields.summary: Date picker shows 'undefined' on Project Release pop-up if the language is set to Russian, French, German or some other language

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a group is available in both the JIRA internal directory and an external directory and was created in each directory with mixed cases, the following error will be shown in the UI when trying to remove a user from this group:
{code:java}
Cannot remove user 'admin' from group 'jira-users-test' since user is not a member of 'jira-users-test'
{code}
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Log in JIRA as a system admin user
 # Create a group called *JIRA-users-test* in the JIRA internal directory (from ⚙ > User Management > Groups)
 # Create a user called *admin* in the JIRA internal directory (from ⚙ > User Management > Users)
 # Add the *admin* user to the *JIRA-users-test* group (from ⚙ > User Management > Users)
 # Create an Apache LDAP directory add to this directory a user called *john* and a group called *jira-users-test* (make sure that the name of the group is in all lower case)
 # Add the user john to the *jira-users-test* group within the LDAP
 # Connect JIRA to this LDAP directory with read/write permission and sync with the directory (from ⚙ > User Management > Directories)
 # Go to the page ⚙ > User Management > Users and look for the 2 users admin and john. Note that the 2 groups *JIRA-users-test* and *jira-users-test* these users belong to are displayed with different cases:
 !Local_UsersWithSameGroup.png|thumbnail!
 # Go to ⚙ > User Management > Groups and note that there is only 1 version of the jira-users-test group, which is *jira-users-test* (the lower-cased version of the 2 groups):
 !Local_Only1Group.png|thumbnail!
 # Click on "Edit Member" next to the jira-users-test group, and try to remove the user 'admin'
 # Go back to ⚙ > User Management > Users, look for the user *admin*, and try to remove the *JIRA-users-test* group from this user

h3. Expected Results
 - In Step 9, the *admin* user should be removed from the group *jira-users-test*
 - In Step 10, the group *JIRA-users-test* should be removed from the user *admin*

h3. Actual Results
 - In step 9, we get the following error:
{code:java}
Cannot remove user 'admin' from group 'jira-users-test' since user is not a member of 'jira-users-test'
{code}
!Local_CantRemoveUserFromGroup.png|thumbnail!

 - In step 10, we get the following error:
{code:java}
You can not remove a group from this user as it is not visible to you
{code}
!Local_CantRemoveGroupFromUser.png|thumbnail!

*Note that on the other hand, JIRA allows me to remove the user *john* from the group 'jira-users-test'*
h3. Troubleshooting

To confirm that you are indeed facing this bug, you can look into the _cwd_group_ and _cwd_membership_ tables in the database and verify that you can see the mixed case versions of the group *jira-users-test* in these tables:
 !Local_Group_DB.png|thumbnail! 
 !Local_Membership_DB.png|thumbnail!

It seems that JIRA treats somehow the 2 versions of the groups as 2 different groups (instead of the same group), and does not map properly users to the right group, and cause the error when we try to remove a user from this group.
h3. Workaround

(!) Please make sure to create a native backup of your JIRA database before running the following query, to that you can revert the changes if anything goes wrong.
 Running the following query will be *at your own risk*.
 - Stop JIRA
 - Backup your database
 - Run the following queries to force the group_name column from the cwd_group table and the parent_name column from the cwd_membership table to be all lower cased *(note that the query to run might slightly different depending on the type of database that you are using)*
{code:java}
update cwd_group set group_name = LOWER(group_name);
update cwd_membership set parent_name = LOWER(parent_name);
{code}

 - Start JIRA
fields.summary: Cannot remove user(s) from certain group(s) if some groups have mixed cases in the database

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
When you do CSV export with the Development field already added to the search result, CSV export doesn't include the Development field.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Link JIRA to Bitbucket. 
# Create a new issue. 
# Commit some data from Bitbucket to populate the issue. 
# Go to issue navigator and search for the issue. 
# Add the Development field. 
# Export via CSV (Current fields) or (All fields). 

+Figure 1: Issue Navigator+
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-14 at 6.28.31 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Expected Results*
The Development field is *included* in the export. 

h3. *Actual Results*
The Development field is *not included* in the export. 

+Figure 2: CSV (Current fields) Exported+
 !Screen Shot 2018-05-14 at 6.40.33 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Workaround*
Use HTML export.
fields.summary: CSV export doesn't include Development field

fields.description:
*Problem description*

We have Project A and Project B.

We need to add a single user picker custom field "Manager" in project A.

We need to add a single user picker custom field "Supervisor" in project B.

Currently, if we must have a unique custom field name, we have to add 2 custom fields in the system.

If we must have 100 unique custom field names for 100 projects (Manager, Supervisor, User, Client, Sales, etc.), we have to add 100 custom fields. 

Adding new 100 custom fields will degrade the system performance.

 

*Solution*

If Jira will have Translate option in Field Configuration instead of Custom Field section, we could create only one custom field "Manager", and configure unique names in a new Translate option section for each projects in the *Field Configuration* (i.e. translation "Manager" for custom field "Manager" in the Field Configuration for project A, translation "Supervisor" for the custom field "Manager" in the Field Configuration for project B, etc.).

Therefore flexible translation in Field Configuration for one custom field will improve system usability and performance.
fields.summary: Add Translate option in Field Configuration, instead of Custom Fields configuration.

h3. Summary

Unable to view workflow in case the workflow name is too long.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a workflow whose name is longer than 255 characters at least
# Make a project to use the workflow
# Go to _Project settings > Workflows > The workflow name you created in Step 1._

h3. Expected Results

The workflow should be shown correctly.

h3. Actual Results

The workflow was not shown and the following ERRROR appeared in the application log.

{code:java}
2018-05-14 04:54:17,319 http-nio-8080-exec-21 ERROR      [c.a.j.web.servlet.InternalServerErrorServlet] {errorId=9c417c5c-d900-433e-9854-0dc5e12a9a1b, interpretedMsg=, cause=com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.IllegalPropertyException: String exceeds 255 characters., stacktrace=com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.IllegalPropertyException: String exceeds 255 characters.

    	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:729) [servlet-api.jar:?]
    	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:230) [catalina.jar:8.5.6]
    	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:165) [catalina.jar:8.5.6]
    	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.server.WsFilter.doFilter(WsFilter.java:52) [tomcat-websocket.jar:8.5.6]
    	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:192) [catalina.jar:8.5.6]
    	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:165) [catalina.jar:8.5.6]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.JiraLastFilter.lambda$doFilter$0(JiraLastFilter.java:39) [classes/:?]

    	at com.atlassian.core.filters.HeaderSanitisingFilter.doFilter(HeaderSanitisingFilter.java:37) [atlassian-core-5.0.8.jar:?]
    	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:192) [catalina.jar:8.5.6]
    	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:165) [catalina.jar:8.5.6]
    	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:39) [atlassian-plugins-servlet-4.5.0.jar:?]
    	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter$1.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:58) [atlassian-plugins-servlet-4.5.0.jar:?]

{code}

h3. Notes

* When you view a workflow from project settings page, the URL should be as follows.
{{http://<jira-base-url>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project-key>/workflow/?name=<workflow-name>}}
To be precise, the URL *without the base URL* ({{plugins/servlet/project-config/<project-key>/workflow/?name=<workflow-name>}}) need to be shorter than 255 characters to avoid this bug.
* When it comes to workflows whose names contain multibyte characters, the workflow URLs tend to easily exceed 255 characters as the workflow names are encoded in the URL.

h3.Workaround

Rename the problematic workflow. (If the workflow is active, you need to make it inactive first and rename it.)
fields.summary: Unable to view workflow in case the workflow name is too long

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When cluster node is renamed in Jira data center, both old name and new name of the node will show up in the 'Cluster nodes' section in 'system info' page. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Would love to have a feature to automatically update the node name or have a function to remove the old name of the node in 'system info' page. 
h3. Workaround

Remove the old name of the cluster node from database table 'clusternode'
fields.summary: Update/remove cluster nodes from Jira data center in system info page

fields.summary: Option For Seconds In Date Time Picker/Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, the plugin would only accept Assertions to be signed for the Authentication regardless of the Response whether it is also signed. In case that the Assertion is not signed, an error like error will appear:
{noformat}
2018-04-27 16:13:04,860 http-nio-8080-exec-43 ERROR anonymous xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx /plugins/servlet/samlconsumer [c.a.p.a.i.web.filter.ErrorHandlingFilter] Received invalid SAML response: The Assertion of the Response is not signed and the SP requires it
com.atlassian.plugins.authentication.impl.web.saml.provider.InvalidSamlResponse: Received invalid SAML response: The Assertion of the Response is not signed and the SP requires it
        at com.atlassian.plugins.authentication.impl.web.saml.provider.impl.OneloginJavaSamlProvider.lambda$extractSamlResponse$1(OneloginJavaSamlProvider.java:89)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSwitchingUtil.runInContext(ContextClassLoaderSwitchingUtil.java:48)
        at com.atlassian.plugins.authentication.impl.web.saml.provider.impl.OneloginJavaSamlProvider.extractSamlResponse(OneloginJavaSamlProvider.java:80)
{noformat}
But, in certain cases, there is a possibility that it will be the Response that is signed rather than the Assertions and such option might not able to be changed by the client as well.

h3. Suggested Solution:
To have the Add-on to accept either the Response or Assertion to be signed in which it could act as a failover system as well.
fields.summary: SAML Authentication Add-on to accept either Assertions or Response to be signed by IDP

h4. Summary

The first option will get selected. Please see the video.

fields.description: The ForgotLoginDetails resource in Atlassian Jira before version 7.6.6, from version 7.7.0 before version 7.7.4, from version 7.8.0 before version 7.8.4 and from version 7.9.0 before version 7.9.2 allows remote attackers to perform a denial of service attack via sending requests to it.
fields.summary: Denial of service through the ForgotLoginDetails resource - CVE-2018-5231

fields.description: The issue collector in Atlassian Jira before version 7.6.6, from version 7.7.0 before version 7.7.4, from version 7.8.0 before version 7.8.4 and from version 7.9.0 before version 7.9.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a cross site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the error message of custom fields when an invalid value is specified.
fields.summary: XSS in the issue collector through invalid values for a custom field - CVE-2018-5230

fields.description: Test was performed with upgrading 6.3.15 to 7.6.4. After setting the flag upgrade.reindex.allowed=false and restarting the 6.3.15 version, upgrade to 7.6.4 was started. After successful upgrade the background re-indexing was started in spite of the flag being set. This seems to be a regression in 7.6.4 from the behaviour in 7.4.0 where it was fixed as per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65568.
fields.summary: Regression : Re-indexing is triggered after Jira upgrade even after setting upgrade.reindex.allowed=false flag.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user profile is set to use the EN(US) locale and does not have any search filters starred as favorites, the 'Favorite Filter' gadget show the EN(UK) spelling, 'favourite', in the default message: {panel}Looks like you haven't selected any {color:red}favourite{color} filters yet. You can either create a new filter, or add an existing filter to display them here on the dashboard.{panel}

h3. Environment
Reproduced in:
* 7.6.2
* 7.8.0
* 7.9.0 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure user profile is set to use EN(US)
# Ensure user account has no favorite filters
# Create a new dashboard
# Add the Favorite Filters Gadget

h3. Expected Results
The default message should say: {panel}Looks like you haven't selected any {color:green}favorite{color} filters yet. You can either create a new filter, or add an existing filter to display them here on the dashboard.{panel}

h3. Actual Results
The default message says: {panel}Looks like you haven't selected any {color:red}favourite{color} filters yet. You can either create a new filter, or add an existing filter to display them here on the dashboard.{panel}


h3.Workaround
Modify the 'dashboard.item.favourite.filters.empty' property in $JIRA_INSTALL_DIR/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/atlassian-bundled-plugins/jira-gadgets-plugin-7.8.0.jar/com/atlassian/jira/gadgets/i18n.properties file.  This will affect both EN locales, so all users selecting an EN locale will see the same message (i.e., this isn't localized).
fields.summary: Translation of Favorite Filter gadget is incorrect for EN(US) locale

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 26 July 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff | titleBGColor=#deebff | bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue. 

I am happy to let you know that comment reactions was shipped in Jira Data Center version 4.18 on the 1st July, 2021.

Please see the [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-18-x-release-notes-1064094444.html#JiraSoftware8.18.xreleasenotes-reactions] for further details on this feature.

Thank you,

Charlie

Jira, Server & Data Center

{panel}
Often I would like to mark that I agree with a users comments without adding to the comment noise (this is different than voting on an issue, I am referring to comments). This I have found is best achieved in other systems such as Github and Slack with the ability to add an emoji as a reaction to the comment. Other users can subsequently +1 the emoji if they have similar sentiments.

This avoids "+1" and "I agree" comments from polluting the discussion.

This addition would make me very 😁
fields.summary: Add abillity to mark other users comments with an emoji to indicate sentiment

fields.description: Currently, only a few JIRA fields are copied when cloning an issues. This request is to allow an option to add other fields to the cloned issue based on user preference. A specific use case is to have radio buttons on the Clone screen to add watchers and links to original story. If they are selected, users would have to enter watchers and links before completing the clone creation process.
fields.summary: Enhancement to Cloning Issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira Issues macro: Displaying issues related to an epic in a restricted project causes "Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error." to display in Confluence if the macro includes either the Epic Name or Epic Link.
h3. Environment

Confluence 6.8.1
 Jira 7.9.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create application link between Confluence and Jira.
 # Create two projects in Jira, project x and project y.  Make project x accessible to all users and set project y's project browse permissions so that not all users can view the project.
 # Create one ticket in Jira project x (TICKET-01).
 # Create one ticket in Jira project y (TICKET-02).
 # Create an epic in project y (EPIC-01) and assign ticket (TICKET-01) to the epic.
 # In Confluence, configure Jira Issue Macro to filter tickets from project x.
 # TICKET-01 should display.
 # Now, change the Jira Issues Macro to display either the "epic name" or "epic link" fields.

h3. Expected Results

Jira Issue Macro should display a message indicating that the issue can't be displayed since it is linked to an epic that resides in a project for which access is restricted.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence displays the following message: "Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error. [View these issues in Jira|http://localhost:8088/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=project+%3D+%22MSP%22++++++&src=confmacro]"

Also, the following exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:

Workaround

Note:

This bug is similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66671

fields.description:
Since the new Jira design, it is no-longer possible to right click on the "create issue" button and open it in a new tab.

This makes it difficult to read other issues while writing a new issue — you have to manually open a new tab and navigate to the page containing the list of issues for your project, which might include search terms/etc.

I frequently end up copying my half written issue text, cancelling the create issue dialog, then opening all of the issues I think I might need in new tabs before finally opening the create issue dialog a second time and pasting in the description (having to manually fill out all the other fields a second time).

Please make the Create issue button an `<a>` tag with a href going to `secure/CreateIssue.jspa` page (with the current project pre-selected), so that the browser will make an "open in new tab" option available. Also holding Command (or control or shift) clicking the link should work as with any other link.

Also, I would love a preference to bind the "c" key to opening this URL in a new tab instead of bringing up the popup.
fields.summary: Cannot open Create Issue URL in a new tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA might see increased memory and GC pressure while responding to search requests fulfilled by Lucene used by 3rd party plugins eg: Zephyr
The plugin can allocate huge amounts of memory very fast, this memory will get collected by a Full GC which might cause increased pauses and could cause OutOfMemoryErrors if the GC was not able to keep up with the fast allocation.

It is important to note that although the Zephyr plugin is mentioned in this ticket, the same issue can be seen with other plugins as well.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.7  (server or Data Center)
* Install a plugin that uses Lucene indexes eg: Zephyr.
* Moderate sized to big JIRA instance 700k issues 400 custom fields.
* Create too many search requests issued by JIRA Zephyr plugin rest API.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
There is no detailed steps to easily reproduce this.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should be able to handle search requests without issues.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA will handle the requests but will progressively allocate huge amounts of org.apache.lucene.search.ScoreDoc objects under org.apache.lucene.search.HitQueue which leads to increased GC pressure.
Millions of Lucene score documents are noticed.
!Screenshot_20180509_201602.png|thumbnail! !Screenshot_20180509_201946.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Developer notes
Please see comment in Dev community with more details covering the problem and suggesting the code changes 
[how-to-avoid-out-of-memory-error-using-searchprovider|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/how-to-avoid-out-of-memory-error-using-searchprovider/25057]

h3.Workaround
Possible workarounds are:
* Disable the offending plugin.
* Reduce the scope of the action performed by the plugin (i.e search, data ranges etc)
fields.summary: Potential Lucene leak on using org.apache.lucene.search.HitQueue / ScoreDoc with plugins using Lucene

fields.description:
In the Jira Supported platforms documentation: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html]

This document indicates that when using MySQL to use the latest jdbc driver:
  
{quote}*MySQL:*
 * JIRA will not work on:
 ** 4 byte characters, regardless of MySQL version
 ** MariaDB nor PerconaDB
 * We recommend running MySQL in strict mode.
 * {color:#d04437}+Supported MySQL databases use the [latest JDBC driver listed here|https://dev.mysql.com/downloads/connector/j/]+.{color} {quote}
 

 
 However recently, MySQL has started releasing a Connector/J in the 8.0 version (and there is a 6.0 version as well). But to date, Jira has never been tested against those specific JDBC drivers and ultimately there are a number of support cases where users have tried to use this because this doc says to use the latest.

We need to amend this document to fall into line with the [Connecting JIRA applications to MySQL - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-938846854.html] which does clearly indicate to use the latest 5.1 version available:
{quote}*To copy the MySQL JDBC driver to your application server:*
 # Get the MySQL driver:

 ** If you are *installing JIRA*, download the recommended MySQL driver [JDBC Connector/J 5.1|http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/connector/j]. 
You can download either the {{.tar.gz}} or the{{ .zip}} file by selecting the _'Platform Independent'_ option. Extract the jar for the driver (e.g. {{mysql-connector-java-5.x.x-bin.jar}}) from the archive.{quote}
 

Also I believe that all the versions of this supported platforms document have this wording and will need to be updated (7.0, 7.1, 7.2, etc)
fields.summary: Jira supported platforms should be more explicit on which MySQL jdbc driver version to use

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36241].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 14 January 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how your teams work and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

We have decided to close this specific request for _additional status categories_ as Won't Fix. The finite set of status categories allows us to build useful features on top of them, like completion progress indicators for Epics and Versions.

We recognize that for many teams, most of the steps in a workflow are "In Progress" and that it can be difficult to distinguish them. Here are some strategies:
* Add additional columns to your board for different workflow states. You can have several "In Progress" columns to represent concepts like "In Development" or "Under Review".
* Use the card colors based on JQL queries feature ([documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Customising+Cards#CustomisingCards-colours]) to define your own colors for workflow states. I've created this suggestion in the JIRA Agile project to improve this in the future: GHS-11666
* Use JIRA Agile card layouts (new in JIRA Agile 6.6) to show the workflow state on the card ([documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Customising+Cards#CustomisingCards-fields])
* To customize the display of issues within the JIRA issue navigator, consider the free third-party [icnavigator add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.iconcept.icnavigator.jira-icnavigator] from Interconcept GmbH.

We do not plan to support arbitrary colors for status categories. The mapping of blue, yellow, and green to "To Do", "In Progress", and "Done" is part of [Atlassian's overall visual system|https://design.atlassian.com/latest/product/components/lozenges/]. Our intent is to improve how we use this pattern to communicate information in JIRA; however, we use the combination of colors and lozenges to represent concepts not only in JIRA, but across Atlassian's product suite.

Finally, there were specific requests for a "Red" status color. The main use case here was situations where an issue had progressed to the end of a workflow, but the resolution was negative (e.g. "Failed" instead of "Done"). In JIRA's structure, this connects the final workflow state (i.e. "Resolved") with the type of resolution. While there's certainly merit in this request, it has the potential to significantly increase JIRA's complexity.

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
JIRA Product Manager
{panel}

The new status colors in JIRA provides initial set of pre-defined statues. It would also be beneficial to add the ability for users to add more categories to it
fields.summary: Ability to add more categories to statuses

fields.description:
h5. Problem
When using the "Update Field" post function to set the assignee of a ticket, it will reference an existing user.  If that user no longer exists in Jira, the post function will show an entirely different workflow transition.

h5. Potential Major Problem
This can cause more problems because users will not be able to perform this transition. If this was on the "Create" transition, users will not be able to create issues.  Admins will then be unable to determine why, as the workflow post-funcion is not apparent.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Have a workflow post function that updates the Assignee field to a specific user
** the post-function list will show something like:
{code}The Assignee of the issue will be set to testuser.{code}
* Delete the testuser account
* Check the post-function again and notice that it says:
{code}
Only users with Create Issues permission can execute this transition.
{code}

h5. Expected Behaviour
The workflow function is still displaying the proper post-function:
{code}The Assignee of the issue will be set to testuser.{code}

h5. Actual Behaivour
The workflow function shows something else:
{code}
Only users with Create Issues permission can execute this transition.
{code}

h5. Workaround
You can still edit this the  "Only users with Create Issues permission can execute this transition." post-function, which will show the update field screen.  You can then change the assignee to an existing user.
fields.summary: Workflow displaying incorrect post functions

If we create stories with emojis in the title this works without issues. But changes to issue titles with emojis show bad encoding in activity stream.

Thus, as you can see the problem is with how the activity stream code tries to escape the UTF-8 emoji along with other HTML tags when sending the response to the browser, to render the payload html.
 When the text is used as part of an object definition or even as a part of a URL anchor string, it is not escaped and thus displays correctly.

Documentation update for updating project roles through REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
In case that a user has been renamed before where {{app_user}} table will have the {{user_key}} and {{lower_user_name}} different, if we use the REST Call to include a user into a certain project role, it will fail.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Cerate a User that able to log in to JIRA.
# Rename the User.
# Execute the REST Call below:
{code}POST /rest/api/2/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role/{id}{code}
# For example,
{code}curl -X POST --data '{"user":["user1"]}' localhost:8730/jira/rest/api/2/project/BA/role/10002 -H 'Content-type: application/json' -H'Accept: application/json' -u admin:admin{code}

h3. Expected Result:
The user will be added to the role.

h3. Actual Result:
This will be thrown instead:
{code}{"errorMessages":["We can't find 'user1' in any accessible user directory. Check they're still active and available, and try again."],"errors":{}}{code}

h3. Workaround:
Use the user {{user_key}}. To check the value, run the query below:
{code:sql}select * from app_user where lower_user_name = '<affected username in lowercase>';{code}

h3. Notes:
- With [JIRA Public REST API documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/] did not specify which need to be used, the expected here is that the REST Call is possible to use the username
- In any case, JIRA should be able to check the {{lower_user_name}} in {{app_user}} table what is the original username is.
fields.summary: Updating roles through REST API did not work using username

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Current status Jira DC recovery from scratch:
# Create a new instance of Jira node: node1
# Deploy Jira to that node1 and connect to DB. 
# Start Jira
# Since there is no index
#* you need to run Full reindex 
#* or recover index from a snapshot.

This is a manual and time-consuming process. In case of AWS deployment with CloudFormation, when it's expected to redeploy the whole cluster for every upgrade problem becomes more important. 

h3. Suggested Solution
As a JIRA Datacenter Administrator I want to do an automated cold recovery from a snapshot. That includes the following steps:
* Periodically create index snapshot at _Shared_home_
* Add option (or JVM flag) for automatic index recovery during start-up 
* If the option is set:
*# search for index snapshot
*# pause start-up 
*# restore index snapshot
*# continue Jira start when the restore is done 
* Log all the steps during the process and preferably expose status through REST API
 
h3. Workaround 
None

h3. Related 
* JRASERVER-66649 - to choose for index recovery vs full reindex 
* JRASERVER-37896 - for standalone Jira

h3. Note on fix
In 8.20.2 we changed the way we qualify snapshot as valid for being picked up on startup. Only snapshots created in less than *24 hours* are considered valid.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Datacenter Administrator I want to do an automated cold recovery from index a snapshot

fields.description:
On Windows 10, using IE 11 specifically, icons are missing from the navigation bar (see attached screenshot). All other browsers and Operating Systems will not exhibit this behavior.

!icons-missing.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
* Windows 10
* Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Login to Jira;
 # Along the navigation bar, you will notice the icons are missing;

h3. Expected Results
Icons appear in the navigation bar

h3. Actual Results
Icons are missing (please see screenshot)

h3. Cause
Windows 10 has a default security feature that blocks certain fonts: [https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/3053676]

h3. Workaround
*Disable this feature:*

h5. Using Group Policy
 # Open the Local Group Policy Editor;
 # Under Local Computer Policy, expand Computer Configuration, then Administrative Templates > System > Mitigation Options;
 # In the Untrusted Font Blocking setting, you can see the following options:
 #* Block untrusted fonts and log events
 #* Do not block untrusted fonts
 #* Log events without blocking untrusted fonts
# Select either of the two last options;
# Restart your computer;

h5. Using Registry Editor
 # Open the Registry Editor (regedit.exe) and go to the following registry subkey:
{{HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\Kernel\}}
 # If the MitigationOptions key is not there, right-click and add a new QWORD (64-bit) Value, naming it as MitigationOptions;
 # Update the Value data of the MitigationOptions key, again choosing one of the two last options for Jira's icons to work properly:
 #* Block untrusted fonts and log events: 1000000000000.
 #* Do not block untrusted fonts: 2000000000000.
 #*  Log events without blocking untrusted fonts: 3000000000000.
(!) *Important:* The existing MitigationOptions value should be preserved. For example, if the current value is 1000, the updated value should be 1000000001000.
 # Restart your computer;
fields.summary: Windows 10 - IE 11 - Jira does not render navigation bar icons

fields.description:
h4. Problem
When moving multiple issues in parallel, the operation may fail silently.  For example, if the move operation attempts to change the issue type of an issue, the move operation seems to succeed. Once the ticket is loaded, we see that the issue type would not have actually changed.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
* Open 2 different issue tickets in 2 tabs on the web browser (ie. TEST-1, TEST-2)
* In TEST-1, click More > Move
* Change browser tab to TEST-2 and click More > Move
* In TEST-1, change the issue type and click Next
* Change tab to TEST-2, change the issue type and click Next
* In TEST-1, make any needed field changes and click Next
* Change tab to TEST-2 and make any field changes and click Next
* In TEST-1, finish the move operation by clicking Move
* In TEST-2, click Move

See attached video:   [^parallel-move-problem.mov] 

h5. Expected Behaviour
Both move operations succeed and the issue types successfully change

h5. Actual Behaviour
One of the move operations will not actually occur. It will just silently fail and not reflect any changes.
fields.summary: Moving Multiple issues in Parallel may Silently Fail
